snippet: Under private equity ownership, HCA made an aggressive push for more revenue that sometimes led to conflicts with doctors and nurses over patient care.
abstract: Profits at giant hospital chain HCA, which controls 163 facilities nationwide, have soared, far outpacing those of most of its competitors; under private equity ownership that includes Bain Capital, HCA has made an aggressive push for more revenue that has sometimes led to conflicts with doctors and nurses over patient care.

byline.original: By JULIE CRESWELL and REED ABELSON

lead_paragraph: Under private equity ownership, HCA made an aggressive push for more revenue that sometimes led to conflicts with doctors and nurses over patient care.

headline.seo: HCA, Giant Hospital Chain, Creates a Windfall for Private Equity
headline.main: A Giant Hospital Chain Is Blazing a Profit Trail
headline.print_headline: A Giant Hospital Chain Is Blazing a Profit Trail
